alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 02 at 11:29AM PDT until April 03 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches for the Warner Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph over exposed areas in the mountains and to 35 mph in the valleys. * WHERE...The Warner Mountains. In California, eastern Modoc County, including Davis Creek and portions of Highway 395 north of Alturas and Highway 299 east of Alturas. In Oregon, portions of Highway 395 south of Lakeview, and the mountains east of both Valley Falls and Lakeview. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Though mainly around an inch, up to 3 inches of snow are expected for the valley floor. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
